15 template <typename VoxelType>
16 bool isSameVoxel(const VoxelType& /* voxel_A */,
17  const VoxelType& /* voxel_B */) {
18  LOG(FATAL) << "Not implemented for this voxel type!";
19  return false;
20 }
21 
22 template <typename VoxelType>
23 bool isSameBlock(const Block<VoxelType>& block_A,
24  const Block<VoxelType>& block_B) {
25  bool is_the_same = true;
26 
27  constexpr double kTolerance = 1e-10;
28 
29  is_the_same &=
30  std::abs(block_A.voxel_size() - block_B.voxel_size()) < kTolerance;
31  is_the_same &=
32  std::abs(block_A.block_size() - block_B.block_size()) < kTolerance;
33  is_the_same &= block_A.voxels_per_side() == block_B.voxels_per_side();
34 
35  is_the_same &=
36  std::abs(block_A.origin().x() - block_B.origin().x()) < kTolerance;
37  is_the_same &=
38  std::abs(block_A.origin().y() - block_B.origin().y()) < kTolerance;
39  is_the_same &=
40  std::abs(block_A.origin().z() - block_B.origin().z()) < kTolerance;
41 
42  is_the_same &= block_A.num_voxels() == block_B.num_voxels();
43 
44  for (size_t voxel_idx = 0u; voxel_idx < block_A.num_voxels(); ++voxel_idx) {
45  is_the_same &= isSameVoxel(block_A.getVoxelByLinearIndex(voxel_idx),
46  block_B.getVoxelByLinearIndex(voxel_idx));
47  }
48  return is_the_same;
49 }
50 
51 template <typename VoxelType>
52 bool isSameLayer(const Layer<VoxelType>& layer_A,
53  const Layer<VoxelType>& layer_B) {
54  constexpr double kTolerance = 1e-10;
55 
56  bool is_the_same = true;
57 
58  is_the_same &=
59  std::abs(layer_A.voxel_size() - layer_B.voxel_size()) < kTolerance;
60  is_the_same &=
61  std::abs(layer_A.block_size() - layer_B.block_size()) < kTolerance;
62 
63  is_the_same &= layer_A.voxels_per_side() == layer_B.voxels_per_side();
64  is_the_same &= layer_A.getNumberOfAllocatedBlocks() ==
65  layer_B.getNumberOfAllocatedBlocks();
66 
67  BlockIndexList blocks_A, blocks_B;
68  layer_A.getAllAllocatedBlocks(&blocks_A);
69  layer_B.getAllAllocatedBlocks(&blocks_B);
70  is_the_same &= blocks_A.size() == blocks_B.size();
71 
72  for (const BlockIndex& index_A : blocks_A) {
73  const BlockIndexList::const_iterator it =
74  std::find(blocks_B.begin(), blocks_B.end(), index_A);
75  if (it != blocks_B.end()) {
76  const Block<VoxelType>& block_A = layer_A.getBlockByIndex(index_A);
77  const Block<VoxelType>& block_B = layer_B.getBlockByIndex(*it);
78  bool is_same_block = isSameBlock(block_A, block_B);
79  LOG_IF(ERROR, !is_same_block)
80  << "Block at index [" << index_A.transpose()
81  << "] in layer_A is not the same as in layer_B";
82  is_the_same &= is_same_block;
83  } else {
84  LOG(ERROR) << "Block at index [" << index_A.transpose()
85  << "] in layer_A does not exists in layer_B";
86  return false;
87  }
88  }
89  for (const BlockIndex& index_B : blocks_B) {
90  const BlockIndexList::const_iterator it =
91  std::find(blocks_A.begin(), blocks_A.end(), index_B);
92  if (it != blocks_A.end()) {
93  const Block<VoxelType>& block_B = layer_A.getBlockByIndex(index_B);
94  const Block<VoxelType>& block_A = layer_B.getBlockByIndex(*it);
95  bool is_same_block = isSameBlock(block_B, block_A);
96  LOG_IF(ERROR, !is_same_block)
97  << "Block at index [" << index_B.transpose()
98  << "] in layer_B is not the same as in layer_A";
99  is_the_same &= is_same_block;
100  } else {
101  LOG(ERROR) << "Block at index [" << index_B.transpose()
102  << "] in layer_B does not exists in layer_A";
103  return false;
104  }
105  }
106 
107  is_the_same &= layer_A.getMemorySize() == layer_B.getMemorySize();
108  return is_the_same;
109 }

120 // This function will shift all the blocks such that the new grid origin will be
121 // close to the centroid of all allocated blocks. The new_layer_origin is the
122 // origin of the new grid expressed in the old grids coordinate frame.
123 template <typename VoxelType>
124 void centerBlocksOfLayer(Layer<VoxelType>* layer, Point* new_layer_origin) {
125  CHECK_NOTNULL(layer);
126  CHECK_NOTNULL(new_layer_origin);
127 
128  // Compute the exact cenroid of all allocated block indices.
129  Point centroid = Point::Zero();
130  BlockIndexList block_indices;
131  layer->getAllAllocatedBlocks(&block_indices);
132  for (const BlockIndex block_index : block_indices) {
133  centroid += layer->getBlockByIndex(block_index).origin();
134  }
135  centroid /= static_cast<FloatingPoint>(block_indices.size());
136 
137  // Round to nearest block index to centroid.
138  centroid /= layer->block_size();
139  const BlockIndex index_centroid =
140  (centroid + 0.5 * Point::Ones()).cast<IndexElement>();
141 
142  // Return the new origin expressed in the old origins coordinate frame.
143  const FloatingPoint block_size = layer->block_size();
144  *new_layer_origin = index_centroid.cast<FloatingPoint>() * block_size;
145 
146  VLOG(3) << "The new origin of the coordinate frame (expressed in the old "
147  << "coordinate frame) is: " << new_layer_origin->transpose();
148 
149  // Loop over all blocks and change their spatial indices.
150  // The only way to do this is to remove them all, store them in a temporary
151  // hash map and re-insert them again. This sounds worse than it is, the blocks
152  // are all shared ptrs and therefore only a negligible amount of real memory
153  // operations is necessary.
154  const size_t num_allocated_blocks_before =
155  layer->getNumberOfAllocatedBlocks();
156  typename Layer<VoxelType>::BlockHashMap temporary_map;
157  for (const BlockIndex& block_index : block_indices) {
158  typename Block<VoxelType>::Ptr block_ptr =
159  layer->getBlockPtrByIndex(block_index);
160  const Point new_origin = block_ptr->origin() - *new_layer_origin;
161  block_ptr->setOrigin(new_origin);
162 
163  // Extract block and shift block index.
164  temporary_map.emplace(block_index - index_centroid, block_ptr);
165  }
166 
167  layer->removeAllBlocks();
168  CHECK_EQ(layer->getNumberOfAllocatedBlocks(), 0u);
169 
170  // Insert into layer again.
171  for (const std::pair<const BlockIndex, typename Block<VoxelType>::Ptr>&
172  idx_block_pair : temporary_map) {
173  layer->insertBlock(idx_block_pair);
174  }
175  CHECK_EQ(layer->getNumberOfAllocatedBlocks(), num_allocated_blocks_before);
176 }
177
